articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hundreds of members of the Lebanese armed group Hezbollah, including fighters and medics, were seriously wounded on Tuesday when the pagers they use to communicate exploded, a security source told Reuters.
articles.title: Hundreds of Hezbollah members wounded in Lebanon when pagers explode, security source says

articles.author: Ami Miyazaki, Shiho Tanaka
articles.description: 海上保安庁は１８日朝、防衛省の情報として、北朝鮮から弾道ミサイルの可能性があるものが発射されたと発表した。発表は２回で、１回目は午前６時５７分ごろ、２回目は７時２８分ごろ。いずれもすでに落下したとみられるという。
articles.title: 北朝鮮から弾道ミサイルの可能性あるもの、海保が2回発表　すでに落下

articles.author: Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: Russian activist Vladimir Kara-Murza shook his head in disbelief as he addressed lawmakers and diplomats in a U.S. Senate hearing room on Tuesday, just weeks after he was released from prison in Siberia in a major prisoner swap.
articles.title: Released Russian dissident Kara-Murza visits US Congress

articles.author: David Ljunggren
articles.description: Doubts about the leadership of Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau intensified after his ruling Liberal Party suffered a second humiliating loss in a special election, but the unpopular leader is determined to cling to office ahead of a looming national vote.
articles.title: Bruised by fresh loss, Canada's Trudeau shows no sign of stepping down

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Music mogul Sean "Diddy" Combs has been hit with three federal charges of racketeering conspiracy, sex trafficking and transportation to engage in prostitution, according to an indictment unsealed on Tuesday.
articles.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs charged with racketeering, sex trafficking

articles.author: Andy Sullivan, Helen Coster, Tim Reid, Richard Cowan
articles.description: Two months after Donald Trump narrowly survived an assassination attempt, a gunman hid undetected for nearly 12 hours on the edge of the golf course where Trump played on Sunday under the protection of an agency that is being pushed to its limits.
articles.title: New apparent Trump assassination attempt highlights Secret Service strains

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Venezuela has arrested a fourth American citizen since the start of this month, the country's Interior Minister Diosdado Cabello said on Tuesday, without naming the person detained.
articles.title: Venezuela arrests fourth US citizen this month, interior minister says

articles.author: Maxwell Adombila
articles.description: Ghana's main opposition National Democratic Congress (NDC) party on Tuesday held nationwide protests against alleged voter roll irregularities, demanding an independent forensic audit to rid the register of errors for free and fair elections.
articles.title: Ghana opposition holds protests against alleged voter roll irregularities

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Barrick Gold has suspended operations at its Porgera gold mine in Papua New Guinea until Thursday after tribal violence in the region killed at least 20.
articles.title: Barrick Gold suspends operations at Papua New Guinea mine after violence kills at least 20

articles.author: Mohammed Torokman, Ali Sawafta
articles.description: Half of the pupils stayed away from classes at an elementary school in the Israeli-occupied West Bank on Tuesday, a day after it was attacked by Jewish settlers with wooden bats in violence that has surged since the Gaza war erupted.
articles.title: Students describe attack by settlers on West Bank elementary school
